Package org.smtlib

This package contains the main classes and abstract interfaces for this SMT-LIB tool; the tool provides a stand-alone SMT-LIB-compliant command-line application, an application that responds to SMT-LIB commands over a network port, and an SMT-LIB Java API.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CharSequenceInfinite.IPrompter
    This interface is used to create prompters.
    IAccept
    This interface is defined and implemented as a marker that the accept method is available and to ensure that subtypes implement the accept method
    ICommand
    This interface is the generic interface to command classes, providing functionality to type-check the command and to execute it.
    ICommand.Iassert
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB assert commands.
    ICommand.Icheck_sat
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB check-sat commands.
    ICommand.Ideclare_fun
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB declare-fun commands.
    ICommand.Ideclare_sort
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB declare-sort commands.
    ICommand.Idefine_fun
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB define-fun commands.
    ICommand.Idefine_sort
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB define-sort commands.
    ICommand.Iexit
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB exit commands.
    ICommand.IFactory
    This is the interface to be used by a concrete ICommand factory.
    ICommand.IFinder
    This interface defines classes that implement techniques for mapping a command name to a class that implements that command.
    ICommand.Iget_assertions
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-assertions commands.
    ICommand.Iget_assignment
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-assignment commands.
    ICommand.Iget_info
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-info commands.
    ICommand.Iget_option
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-option commands.
    ICommand.Iget_proof
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-proof commands.
    ICommand.Iget_unsat_core
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-unsat-core commands.
    ICommand.Iget_value
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB get-value commands.
    ICommand.Ipop
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB pop commands.
    ICommand.Ipush
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB push commands.
    ICommand.IScript
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB scripts.
    ICommand.Iset_info
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB set-info commands.
    ICommand.Iset_logic
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB set-logic commands.
    ICommand.Iset_option
    Interface to be implemented by all objects representing SMT-LIB set-option commands.
    IExpr
    This interface represents the functionality for any class implementing an SMT-LIB term or formula
    IExpr.IAsIdentifier
    This interface represents SMT-LIB identifiers that are sort qualifiers on function ids
    IExpr.IAttribute<TT extends IExpr.IAttributeValue>
    This interface represents an SMT-LIB attribute-value pair
    IExpr.IAttributedExpr
    This interface represents an SMT-LIB expression with attributes.
    IExpr.IAttributeValue
    This interface represents the general class of attribute values; in the abstract syntax it has no particular structure, though it does include true, false, string literals, numerals, and various pre-defined constants.
    IExpr.IBinaryLiteral
    This interface represents SMT-LIB binary literals
    IExpr.IBinding
    This interface represents a binding of a parameter and an expression
    IExpr.IDecimal
    This interface represents non-negative decimal numbers of arbitrary size (i.e.
    IExpr.IDeclaration
    This interface represents a declaration of a parameter and its sort
    IExpr.IError
    This interface represents an error, e.g.
    IExpr.IExists
    This interface represents an SMT-LIB quantified exists expression
    IExpr.IFactory
    The interface defining the factory type for producing objects of various subtypes of IExpr; the IPos argument is an optional argument giving information about the textual position of an expression.
    IExpr.IFcnExpr
    This interface represents SMT-LIB expressions that are a function identifier applied to one or more arguments.
    IExpr.IForall
    This interface represents an SMT-LIB quantified forall expression
    IExpr.IHexLiteral
    This interface represents SMT-LIB hex literals
    IExpr.IIdentifier
    This interface represents SMT-LIB identifiers (either ids or parameterized ids)
    IExpr.IKeyword
    This interface represents SMT-LIB attribute and infoflag names.
    IExpr.ILet
    This interface represents an SMT-LIB let-expression
    IExpr.ILiteral
    This interface represents all literal (explicit constant) expressions.
    IExpr.INumeral
    This interface represents non-negative integers of arbitrary size.
    IExpr.IParameterizedIdentifier
    This interface represents SMT-LIB parameterized identifiers
    IExpr.IQualifiedIdentifier
    This interface represents SMT-LIB identifiers for function ids (either ids or parameterized ids or as-type identifiers)
    IExpr.IStringLiteral
    This interface represents SMT-LIB string literals
    IExpr.ISymbol
    This interface represents SMT-LIB ids; equal ids have equal (using .equals) values of value().
    IExpr.ISymbol.ILetParameter  
    IExpr.ISymbol.IParameter  
    ILanguage
    This interface represents the functionality of an SMT-LIB language - the combination of one or more theories and various restrictions on the permitted expressions.
    ILogic
    This interface represents a definition of an SMT_LIB logic
    IParser
    This is the interface to a parser for SMT-LIB.
    IParser.IFactory
    The interface for the parser/printer factory
    IPos
    This is an interface that supplies information about a range in textual position within a source of characters.
    IPos.IPosable
    This interface identifies classes that can have their position set
    IPrinter
    An interface for printers to concrete syntax; factories are shared with Parsers in IParser.IFactory.
    IResponse
    This interface represents responses that can be received from SMT-LIB commands.
    IResponse.IAssertionsResponse  
    IResponse.IAssignmentResponse  
    IResponse.IAttributeList  
    IResponse.IError
    The interface for error responses
    IResponse.IFactory
    The interface representing the factory for IResponse instances
    IResponse.IPair<T1,T2>
    An interface for simple pairs of objects
    IResponse.IProofResponse  
    IResponse.IUnsatCoreResponse  
    IResponse.IValueResponse  
    ISolver
    This is the interface to be implemented by any solver adapter; there is an abstract method for each SMT-LIB command
    ISort
    The interface for an SMT-LIB concept of a Sort.
    ISort.IAbbreviation
    This interface represents a new Sort symbol designating an abbreviation for a (possibly parameterized) sort expression.
    ISort.IApplication
    The interface for a Sort expression that consists of either an arity 0 sort symbol or a positive-arity symbol with the appropriate number of arguments.
    ISort.IDefinition
    A super-interface for definitions of new sort ids.
    ISort.IFactory
    The interface for a Sort-creating factory
    ISort.IFamily
    This interface represents a new Sort symbol designating either a new Sort (if the arity is 0) or a new parameterized Sort family (if the arity is greater than 0); each new symbol has a (new) name and a non-negative arity.
    ISort.IFcnSort
    An interface to represent the Sort of a function; this is not something that can be written as a sort expression in SMT-LIB, but it is convenient to be able to represent the sorts of function ids uniformly with the sorts of other ids.
    ISort.IParameter
    The interface for a sort parameter, as used in sort abbreviations (including in the defining expression).
    ISource
    This interface represents sources of characters.
    ITheory
    This interface represents a definition of an SMT-LIB theory
    IVisitor<T>
    This is a visitor interface for visitors over IExpr ASTs.
    Log.IListener
    This is an interface to be implemented by any Object that wants to hear log messages; the Object must register itself by calling Log.addListener.
    SMT.IConfiguration  
    SMT.ILogicFinder  
    Version  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractSolver
    This class implements all the operations of the org.smtlib.ISolver interface to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
    CharSequenceInfinite
    This class implements a CharSequence that obtains its characters from a source of characters of unknown length; it also provides some functionality to retain the characters and compute line numbers.
    CharSequenceReader
    This class implements a CharSequence that obtains its characters from a Reader.
    CharSequenceSocket
    This class implements a CharSequence that obtains its characters from a ServerSocket.
    Driver
    The Driver class is a client that can send commands to the SMT application acting as a server.
    FileTests  
    InfoOptions  
    ISort.ErrorDefinition
    This class is an instance of a sort definition that represents an erroneous definition of a Sort; by defining an actual IDefinition, excessive propagation of errors is avoided.
    IVisitor.NullVisitor<T>
    This class is an implementation of IVisitor, meant to be used as a base class for further derivation; it implements all of the visitors to simply return null - that is it will not walk the tree without further implementation.
    IVisitor.TreeVisitor<T>
    This class is an implementation of IVisitor meant fur further derivation: each visitor is implemented to visit its children without doing anything else; the default return value is null.
    JUnitListener  
    LetTests  
    Log
    This class is used as a collection point for all output.
    Logics  
    LogicsBadPath  
    LogicsBase  
    LogicsWithPath  
    LogicTests  
    ParseCommand
    Tests parsing commands, without invoking solvers
    ParseExpressionErrors
    Tests parsing invalid expressions, without invoking solvers
    ParseExpressions
    Tests parsing valid expressions without invoking solvers
    QuantTests  
    RunTests  
    SatChecks  
    SMT
    This is the main class for the SMT-LIB tool.
    SMT.Configuration
    The configuration object holds the values of all of the current options (e.g.
    SMT.Prompter
    This class is a prompter used when more data is needed from a data source
    SolverProcess
    This class implements launching, writing to, and reading responses from a launched process (in particular, solver processes).
    SymbolTable
    This class manages a symbol table used for storing definitions and looking up ids in expressions.
    SymbolTable.Entry
    An object that holds all the information about the defined symbol (or aliased definition).
    SymbolTable.Iterator
    An iterator over all of the Symbols in the symbol scope stack from the top-most scope on down.
    TypeCheck  
    TypeCheckBV  
    TypeChecker
    This class is a visitor that type-checks a formula
    TypeChecker.Variable  
    TypeCheckInt  
    TypeCheckQuantifiers  
    TypeCheckRealsInts  
    TypeCheckRoot  
    Utils
    A class of static utility methods and constants for the SMT-LIB package.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    IParser.AbortParseException
    An exception to be thrown if parsing is to be intentionally aborted (and restarted, ignoring any tokens since the last successful call to the parser.
    IParser.ParserException
    An exception thrown if parsing is to be aborted.
    IParser.SyntaxException
    An exception to be thrown if there is an unrecoverable problem scanning the syntax
    IVisitor.VisitorException
    An Exception class to use if there is a problem during execution of an IVisitor (e.g.
    SMT.InternalException
    This class is used to turn internal bugs that we do not want to try to recover into exceptions that can be reported
    SolverProcess.ProverException
    Wraps an exception thrown because of a failure in the prover
    Utils.SMTLIBException
    An Exception class used by the library

Package org.smtlib Description

This package contains the main classes and abstract interfaces for this SMT-LIB tool; the tool provides a stand-alone SMT-LIB-compliant command-line application, an application that responds to SMT-LIB commands over a network port, and an SMT-LIB Java API. For a tool that encapsulates this functionality as an Eclipse plug-in, see the companion package org.smtlib.plugin.
